title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.6.33 | 28-11-2021
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

themes: Appearance of the Lord in the heart
segments.key_quote: The Supreme Lord Shri Krishna, whose glories and activities are pleasing to hear, at once appears on the seat of my heart as if called for.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse and explains that the Lord appears in the heart of the devotee who hears His glories.

segments.key_quote: Absolute Truth is Truth which is... Truth in all phases of time. Past, Present and Future.
segments.summary: The speaker defines Absolute Truth as unchanging and contrasts it with Relative Truth, which is subject to change in the material world, using the example of a person residing in a house.

segments.key_quote: Spiritual existence is full of Rasa... spirit is dynamic unlike matter matter is static.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that spiritual existence is unchanging yet full of Rasa (flavor) and is dynamic, unlike static matter, emphasizing Krishna as the ultimate source of everything.

themes: Names, Fame, and Activities of the Lord
segments.key_quote: As soon as a pure devotee engages himself in the pure devotional service of hearing chanting and remembering the name fame and activities of the Lord... shravanam kirtanam smaranam
segments.summary: The speaker describes the process of devotional service, particularly hearing, chanting, and remembering the Lord's names, fame, and activities.

segments.key_quote: At once the Supreme Lord becomes visible to the transcendental eyes of the pure devotee... he reflects himself on the mirror of the heart by spiritual television.
segments.summary: The speaker uses the analogy of a spiritual television to explain how the Lord becomes visible in the heart of a pure devotee engaged in devotional service.

segments.key_quote: Sri Narada chants the glorification of the Lord not only for his personal benefit but he is doing it for the benefit of everyone especially in this material world.
segments.summary: The speaker highlights Narada Muni's chanting for the benefit of others and emphasizes the power of hearing the Lord's glories from pure devotees, even for those not spiritually advanced.
